medical_history.chief_complaint: Further evaluation and management of vesicoureteral reflux.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms first began at 1 year of age with a temperature of 39.5Â°C and irritability. The patient was treated for a urinary tract infection. Follow-up examinations showed persistent bilateral grade III vesicoureteral reflux over the years, although the patient has been well with no urinary tract infections for the past year after discontinuing prophylactic antibiotics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Vesicoureteral reflux diagnosed after a febrile urinary tract infection at 1 year of age. The patient has had several episodes of high fever, but no documented urine cultures during those episodes. No history of constipation or bowel irregularities.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had a urinary tract infection during pregnancy. Maternal grandmother has hypertension. No family history of chronic kidney disease.
medical_history.social_history: The family has moved several times, which has affected the adherence to antibiotic prophylaxis.
